adrFormatAddress: 1755 York Ave, New York, NY 10128-6849, USA

originalText.text: I had PRK surgery 6 months ago with Dr. Jeffrey Dello Russo. Anyone considering any kind of surgery should do their research and go to multiple Dr consultations (I regret not doing this). They pressured me into a non-refundable deposit the day of the consultation or they wouldn't give me the $1k discount. In retrospect, that was a red flag. I was actually told by the Dr. during my consultation that I'd be getting Lasik, which has a shorter recovery time and is much less painful, but the day of surgery I was told I'd be getting PRK because my corneas were thin (didn't he see that in the consultation?) even though the Dr had told me otherwise prior, so that was concerning. Friends who had done both Lasik and PRK with other Drs all ensured me this would be life changing and so worth it... well, I will tell you it absolutely was not. Now, I struggle to see at night with halos and glares and my right eye is blurry with double vision. I don't know whether they screwed up, but I certainly wish I went to a different Dr or I just continued wearing contacts rather than spending the thousands of dollars for a botched and excruciatingly painful surgery (PRK was the most painful experience of my life). Then the wasted time and missed work or trekking to BK or the UES once a month to be told "well it's not perfect 20/20 but it's close enough"...As an update, I finally met with the Dr yesterday for the first time since surgery in November. He confirmed that I went from -6 vision to +1 in that eye, and I still don't really understand how this happened. He said only 2% of patients have to come back for a second PRK procedure, but having done more research I think this statistic is drastically understated. He gave me contacts to try, but even with them my vision isn't as clear as it was with contacts before the surgery. Hopefully this can help others who are considering this procedure.

originalText.text: I want to send a great big "Thank You" to Dr. Jeff Dello Russo and his wonderful staff from Dello Russo Laser Vision. I now feel like I'm seeing the world for the first time, and it's crystal clear. After using glasses from such a young age, to now being able to see perfectly clear just takes my breath away. Words can not express my amazement.

text.text: I want to send a great big "Thank You" to Dr. Jeff Dello Russo and his wonderful staff from Dello Russo Laser Vision. I now feel like I'm seeing the world for the first time, and it's crystal clear. After using glasses from such a young age, to now being able to see perfectly clear just takes my breath away. Words can not express my amazement.

originalText.text:
Dr Jeffrey Dello Russo: I had the best experience ever with the doctor and his staff. Don't get me wrong at first I was worried because I really didn't know anybody that had done Lasik recently. One thing for sure that I went went online, read and saw video's which made it worse. But I am very happy to say that when I actually went through it, it was nothing like it I saw online. Actually it was much quicker and faster. What took the longest was waiting to be called. For the people that are planning to get Lasik, I highly recommend Dr. Jeffrey Dello Russo. The whole procedure in both eyes take about 7-10 and that's pushing it. Trust me, you are not going to regret it at all. It's like you were reborn once again. :)

Ahmen: Ahmen was the best of the best. He is very patient with question's or concern's that you may need to be answered. He tells you himself, you can call me or even text me anytime. He will definitely get back to you(be on the look out for that call or text). Any doubts you have, ask away. Ahmen is available, It felt like the commercials he is there for your 24/7 LOL

STAFF: But honestly speaking, the STAFF is wonderful. They make you feel really comfortable at all times. If you walk in nervous, by the time you meet with the staff your forgot about it because they talk to you and help you calm down. (remember the STAFF, Doctor and Ahmen have done this procedure a million of times) No need to be nervous at all. Just HAPPY because you're getting re-born with your NEW pair of eyes lol

Con's: Can't use your phone or watch T.V the day or the surgery.(But really, one day with electronics is easy :D

{Just remember once you get the surgery don't let no water get into your eyes at all, specially if it rains (that's a tough one}

If you want Lasik- my suggestion GO FOR IT! YOU HAVE NADA TO LOSE! :D

originalText.text: I want to give a BIG 20/15 Thank You to Dr. Dello Russo and all the employees as well. Got the procedure done on Saturday and got my vision right away. This is more than what I expected. Thanks so much to the Dello Russo team!!!!!!!!!!

originalText.text: Very accommodating and Friendly staff. Everyone follows social distancing. Dr. Dello Russo was excellent! Definitely recommend!
